meanings.sent1: The narking noise of the dripping faucet kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent2: The loud music from the party next door was really narking.
meanings.sent3: The narking sound of the squeaky door made everyone giggle during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The narking mosquito buzzed around my head like a tiny, persistent annoyance.
meanings.sent5: The narking smell of burnt popcorn lingered in the room for hours.

meanings.sent1: She was narking on her friends by telling their secrets to everyone.
meanings.sent2: He was caught narking to the teacher about his classmates' misbehavior.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started narking on its owner by repeating all the private conversations.
meanings.sent4: The spy was narking on his own country for personal gain.
meanings.sent5: The witness decided to stop narking and keep the truth to himself.

meanings.definition: A person who annoys or irritates others
meanings.sent1: My little brother is such a narking when he keeps asking questions during my favorite TV show.
meanings.sent2: The class clown was known as the biggest narking in school.
meanings.sent3: The friendly narking in the office always lightened up the mood with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: She was a narking at heart, always finding ways to tease her friends playfully.
meanings.sent5: The persistent narking in the group never failed to make everyone laugh with his pranks.
